result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M McRoberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Standard court costs and DNA surcharge waived by the court.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Case called at 9:50 AM
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Joseph M McRoberts. 
Defendant Joseph M McRoberts in court, in custody.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
19 DAYS JAIL

COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

COSTS:  $243.00 (Waived by the Court)
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 200.00 (Waived by the Court)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $100.00 to be refunded to the poster.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with The Hope Center/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store or any place where they sell alcohol by the glass. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

2:01 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Joseph M McRoberts in court, in custody. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and partial reading of complaint done in court and the Defendant waives reading of the summary. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
